source_sentence: 佛說太子慕魄經
translation: Foshuo taizi mupo jing

source_sentence: 後漢安息三藏安世高譯
translation: An Shigao Translation of the Tripiṭaka of the Latter Han Dynasty

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，佛在舍衛國祇洹阿難邠坻阿藍。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Āpaṇḍinābhūmi in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時，佛語諸比丘：「我身宿命為波羅[木*奈]國王作太子，名曰慕魄；始生有異，顏貌端正，絕無雙比。
translation: The Buddha then said to the monks, "My past life was to be crown prince named Mupo to the king of Bālā [munai], and I was born with a difference in my first birth, with a face so beautiful that it's unequalled.

source_sentence: 自識宿命，無數劫事，所更善惡，罪福受報，壽夭好醜；沒此生彼，所從來生，皆悉知見。
translation: I've been aware of my past lives, the events of countless eons, the good and bad deeds I've done, the rewards of good and bad actions, and the good and bad aspects of my life; I've seen everything from birth here and there to birth in the past.

source_sentence: 年十三歲，閉口不言。
translation: When he was 13 years old, he shut up and didn't say anything.

source_sentence: 「王唯有此一子耳，舉國人民皆重愛之，當繼後嗣襲續王位；然以追識宿命，億載存亡禍福，故質不語至十三歲，捐棄形骸，志存虛無，漂漂不說，飢寒恬淡，質朴意如枯木——雖有耳目，不存視聽；智慮雖遠，如無心志；不畏污辱，亦無憎愛；若盲若聾，不說西東；狀如矇聵，不與人同。
translation: "The king had only this one son, whom all the people of the country loved and who would succeed him on the throne; but because he was conscious of his past lives and the fate of billions of years of existence and death, he remained silent until he was 13 years old, abandoned his physical body, kept his mind in space, drifted about without speaking, starved and went cold and quiet, and had a simple mind like withered wood - though he had ears and eyes, he didn't see and hear; though his wisdom and deliberation were distant, he had no intention; though he didn't fear defilement, he didn't hate it; though blind and deaf, he didn't speak about the west and east; his appearance was as if he was blind and didn't share with others.

source_sentence: 「父王憂慮，甚用患苦，深恥隣國，恐見陵嗤。
translation: "His father was worried and greatly distressed, and he was deeply ashamed of his neighboring country, fearing that he would be ridiculed.

source_sentence: 因呼國中諸婆羅門問之：『此子何故不能言語乎？』
translation: He therefore summoned the country's brāhmaṇas and asked them, 'Why can't this child speak?'

source_sentence: 婆羅門相視言：『此子惡人也，雖面目端正殊好，內懷不親；觀相默默，欲害父母，危國滅宗，將至不久，不可畜養。
translation: The Brāhmaṇas looked at each other and said, 'This son of mine is a bad person. Although he has a good face, he doesn't have any internal affection; he looks at his features in silence, wants to harm his father and mother, endangers his country and disappears his lineage, and will soon be unprovable as a keeper.

source_sentence: 既不能語，當何益王耶！
translation: Since he can't speak, what good will he do to the king?'

source_sentence: 今王了不復生子者，皆是惡子所防固也，是使大王不復生子耳。
translation: Now, the king's failure to have another child is due to the fact that he's being defended by a bad son, which is why the king won't have another child.

source_sentence: 王宜棄捐，當生埋之。
translation: It's better for the king to discard them and bury them.

source_sentence: 爾乃王身可全，保國安宗，然後更得生貴子耳；不者甚危！』
translation: Then the king's body can be preserved and his country secured, and then he'll be able to give birth to another noble son; it's very dangerous not to!'

source_sentence: 「王信狂愚，謂為審然。
translation: "The king was convinced that he was crazy and foolish, and he said he was judicious.

source_sentence: 即用愁憂，坐起不寧，伎樂不御，服美不甘。
translation: He immediately became sad and troubled, unable to sit or rise, unable to perform music or dress, and unable to enjoy himself.

source_sentence: 則與長者、大臣共議之云：『如之何？
translation: He then conferred with the elders and ministers, saying, 'What's the matter?'

source_sentence: 或有臣言，遠棄深山無人之處；或有臣言，投沈深水。』
translation: Some ministers say, 'Perhaps they'll abandon themselves far away in a deep mountainous region with no one living there; some ministers say they'll plunge into deep water.'

source_sentence: 有一臣言：『當如師語，但作深坑，傍入如室，給與資糧、侍以五僕，生置其中。
translation: One minister said, 'According to the teacher's advice, you should simply make a deep pit, enter it like a room on the side, provide provisions, attend on five servants, and put your life in it.

source_sentence: 從命所如，空刓絕之為。』
translation: Do as you're told, and trim them away with emptiness.'

source_sentence: 「王即隨此臣所言，即晨遣僕，故出埋之。
translation: "The king then followed this minister's advice and sent his servants out in the morning to bury them.

source_sentence: 太子心內悲感，傷其愚惑，矜慜無量。
translation: The prince's heart was filled with compassion, saddened by his foolishness, and his feelings of gratitude were immeasurable.

source_sentence: 其母憐哀，心為傷絕，言：『我無相生子，薄命乃值此殃，痛斷我腸。』
translation: His mother took pity on him and was heartbroken, saying, 'I was born without a son, and my life was so short that I was saddened by this calamity; it hurts my intestines.'

source_sentence: 哽噎涕泣，悲懷喐吚，感戀靡逮。
translation: She choked back tears, weeping, grieving, cringing, and yearning for him.

source_sentence: 事不得已，俛仰放捨，遣人載出，當埋棄之。
translation: He had no choice but to relinquish it and send someone to take it away and bury it.

source_sentence: 悉取太子所有衣被、瓔珞、珠寶，皆用送之。
translation: He took all of the prince's robes, mourning cloth, and jewelry and gave them away.

source_sentence: 「復使於外，盡脫取其衣被、珠寶，持著一面，因共作坑。
translation: "He then sent them outside, took all his robes and jewelry, held them to one side, and made a pit together.

source_sentence: 作坑未竟，慕魄獨於車上，深自思惟，心與口語：『今王以下及人民，皆共謂我為審聾癡瘂不能語也；吾所以不語者，正欲捨世緣，安身避惱，濟神離苦耳，今反當為誑詐所危。』
translation: Before he finished building the pit, Mupo was alone in his chariot, reflecting deeply on himself and saying to himself and his people, 'Now, the king and the people below say that I'm too judgmentally deaf and dumb to speak; I didn't speak because I wanted to abandon worldly conditions, make myself comfortable, and escape misery, and save my soul from suffering; now, I'll be deceived and endangered.'

source_sentence: 既沒身命，陷墮彼人，便默自取衣被、珠寶持去。
translation: Having lost his life and fallen into the trap of that person, he then silently takes his own clothing and jewelry and carries them away.

source_sentence: 作坑人輩，不覺慕魄取物去。
translation: Those who act like pits don't realize that Mupo took their things and left.

source_sentence: 「時，慕魄則到水邊，淨自洗浴，以香塗身，悉取衣被、瓔珞著之，到坑問曰：『作坑何施？』
translation: "Mupo then went to the water's edge, washed himself, rubbed himself with incense, and put on all of his robes and jewelry, going to the pit and asking, 'What's the gift for making a pit?'

source_sentence: 其僕對曰：『國王有子，名曰慕魄，瘖瘂聾癡，年十三歲，不能言語。
translation: His servants told him, 'The king has a son named Mupo who's dumb and deaf, 13 years old, and unable to speak.

source_sentence: 王問婆羅門，婆羅門師白言：「當生埋之，爾乃安吉全國榮宗，利後子孫，以用是故。」
translation: The king asked the Brāhmaṇa about it, and the Brāhmaṇa teacher said, 'He will be buried alive, so that the whole country will be blessed with a prosperous lineage and future generations will benefit from it.'

source_sentence: 我等作坑，欲埋慕魄。』
translation: We've made a pit to bury Mupo.'

source_sentence: 慕魄即曰：『我則是太子慕魄也。』
translation: The mupo then said, 'I am Prince Mupo.'

source_sentence: 人即驚悚，衣毛為竪，馳走往趣，視其車上，不見慕魄；還至坑所，諦熟觀察，聽聞言語，絕有異聲，光景如月，世所希聞；動其左右，行者為止，坐者為起，飛鳥走獸，皆來會聚，伏太子前，聽太子語。
translation: They were terrified, and their hair on their heads rose as they rushed toward him, looked at his chariot, and didn't see Mupo. When they returned to the pit, they carefully observed him and heard him speak, saying things that were absolutely silent and whose appearance was like the moon, which is unheard of in the world.

source_sentence: 「慕魄又曰：『觀我手足，察我形容，云何群迷誑詐所惑，以謬為諦，生相捐棄？』
translation: "Mupo also said, 'Look at my hands and feet, examine my features, why are they so deluded and deceived, mistaking my truth for that of the truth, and creating abandonment?'

source_sentence: 發意所陳，言成文章，左右惶敬，已咸惶露，上合下同，靡不順從。
translation: When he expressed his intention and made his speech into an article, his left and right were terrified and respectful, and they were all terrified and revealed that they were in agreement with the superior and inferior, and none of them complied.

source_sentence: 其儀大惶，征營悚慄，兩兩相視，面目竝青，咸曰：『太子甚神，乃如是也。』
translation: Their officials were terrified, and the troops were frightened as they looked at each other, their faces all turned blue, and they all said, 'The prince is quite a god, isn't he?'

source_sentence: 皆前作禮，叩頭求哀：『願赦我罪，共還入宮，到父王所。』
translation: They all bowed their heads in prostration and begged for mercy, 'May my sins be forgiven, and we'll all go back to the palace and go to our father's place.'

source_sentence: 慕魄曰：『今已見棄，不宜復還也。
translation: Mupo said, 'Now that we've seen him abandoned, it's not advisable to return.

source_sentence: 汝徑自往，白王令知。』
translation: Go on your own way and tell the king that you'll be informed.'

source_sentence: 僕即犇馳，白王如是。
translation: The servant then rushed off and told the king as much.

source_sentence: 其母哀傷，使人問狀，僕曰：『太子甚神，開口一言，真驚恐人，聞者皆擾，行者滿道。』
translation: His mother was sad and asked someone to question him about his condition. The servant said, 'The prince is so divine that when he opens his mouth and speaks, he truly frightens people.

source_sentence: 王則愕然，且喜且悲，深怪所以。
translation: The king was stunned, delighted, and saddened, and wondered deeply about the reason.

source_sentence: 「王與夫人，便共驂駕，往迎太子；國民大小，莫不馳動，觀瞻滿道。
translation: "The king and his wife then drove their carts to meet the prince, and the people, large and small, rushed to meet him and filled the road with people watching.

source_sentence: 咸曰：『太子類如欲見神形。』
translation: They all said, 'The prince looks like he wants to see the form of a god.'

source_sentence: 王未到頃，慕魄心即自念：『當學道耳，適發此意。』
translation: Before the king arrived, Mupo's mind immediately thought to itself, 'I'll train in the ways of the world, so I'll give rise to this idea.'

source_sentence: 天帝釋即為化作園觀浴池，眾果樹木，快樂無比。
translation: Then Śakra created for him a garden, a bathing pool, and trees and fruits of unsurpassed joy.

source_sentence: 慕魄即便脫去著身好衣、珠寶，轉作道人，被服儼然。
translation: Mupo then took off the fine clothing and jewelry with which he was clothed and transformed into a Way-follower, fully clothed.

source_sentence: 「王前欲到，逢見慕魄在樹下坐。
translation: "The king was about to arrive when he met Mūpa sitting under a tree.

source_sentence: 慕魄見王來到，即起迎逆，王為作禮。
translation: When Mupo saw the king coming, he rose to greet him, and the king paid homage to him.

source_sentence: 慕魄則曰：『大王就坐。』
translation: Mupo then said, 'Great king, take your seat.'

source_sentence: 王聞慕魄語言音聲，威神光景，震動天地，絕無雙比，即大歡喜，便曉慕魄：『共還入國，居位理政，吾請避退。』
translation: When the king heard Mupo's voice and speech, his dignified appearance shook heaven and earth like nothing else, and he was overjoyed, he told Mupo, 'Let's go back to the country together and take up positions of authority; I'd like to retire.'

source_sentence: 「慕魄曰：『不可，不可！
translation: "Mupo said, 'No, no!'

source_sentence: 我以畏厭地獄勤苦，愁毒萬端。
translation: I'm afraid of the pain and suffering of hell, which causes me a lot of grief.

source_sentence: 吾昔曾更作此國王，名曰須念，以正法治國，奉行諸善，二十五年鞭杖不行，刀兵不設，牢獄無繫者。
translation: In the past, I was once another king of this country named Suni, who rightly ruled the country and upheld goodness. 25 years ago, I wasn't whipped or caned, my sword wasn't used, and I wasn't imprisoned.

source_sentence: 惠施仁愛，恩流德布，救濟窮乏，無所貪惜。
translation: He bestowed kindness and love, spread kindness and virtue, and saved the poor and needy without craving.

source_sentence: 雖有此行，猶犯微闕，終墮地獄，六萬餘歲；蒸煑剝裂，痛酷難忍，求死不得，欲生不得。
translation: Despite these deeds, they still violated a slight deficiency and ended up in hell for more than 60,000 years; they were steamed, stripped, and stripped of their leaves, suffering unbearable pain, unable to seek death, and unable to wish for life.

source_sentence: 當爾之時，父母在處，雖有資財，億載無數，富而且貴，快樂無極。
translation: At the time, my parents were there, although they had possessions that were numberless and billions, wealth, and prosperity, and their happiness knew no bounds.

source_sentence: 寧能知我在彼，地獄拷治劇乎？
translation: How could they have known that I was there, that I was being tortured and punished in hell?

source_sentence: 豈復能來分取我身苦痛？
translation: How could it be possible for someone to come and share in my physical suffering?

source_sentence: 不也。
translation: "No.

source_sentence: 「『我所以墮罪者何？
translation: "'What is the reason I fell into sin?'

source_sentence: 往昔作此大國王時，小國王附庸諸域，皆悉統屬。
translation: In the past, when he was king of this great country, the small kingdoms that were subordinate to him were all subordinated.

source_sentence: 王性慈仁，其德至淳，法令不嚴，諸小國王皆輕慢易，咸共謀議：「今此大王謹善軟弱，威禁不攝，德不堪任統御大國；當共攻伐，廢退之耳。」
translation: The king's kindness and benevolence were so great and his virtue so simple that his decrees weren't strict. The smaller kings were all conspiring together, saying, "Now, this great king is gentle and weak, his authority and discipline aren't subdued, and his virtue isn't sufficient to govern a large country; we should attack together and subdue him."

source_sentence: 即舉兵眾來攻大國。
translation: They then raised a large army to attack the great kingdom.

source_sentence: 時王須念，逆以珍奇財寶，皆賜遺之，復以重官厚祿撫順慰喻，誘而安之。
translation: When the king needed to be mindful, he bestowed rare treasures on them and offered them heavy officials and generous pay to pacify them and entice them to settle down.

source_sentence: 即皆止息，各還本國。
translation: They were all calmed down and each returned to his own country.

source_sentence: 如是未久，復來攻伐，數數非一。
translation: Before long, they came back to attack and invade in more ways than one.

source_sentence: 大國群僚，咸共瞋恚，上白大王：「諸小臣國，愚戇無義，不慮罪舋，數為慢突。
translation: The officials of the great nation were all enraged and said to the king, "Those small vassal states are foolish and aimless, don't think about crimes and provocations, and are often arrogant.

source_sentence: 造成悖逆，觸犯尊上，令民馳擾，警備不息。
translation: They cause disobedience, violate the venerable, and cause the people to be disturbed and guarded without respite.

source_sentence: 當應誅討，以除寇害。」
translation: They should be summarily punished to remove the pests."

source_sentence: 王曰：「為民父母，當務仁化，恕己育物，危命濟眾；彼猶嬰孩，愍其無識，以漸誘導，不忍加害也。」
translation: The king said, "As parents of the people, they should work to kindly teach, forgive themselves and nurture things, and rescue the many people in danger; they're like infants, whom we pity for their lack of awareness and gradually guide so that we won't tolerate harming them."

source_sentence: 王懷弘慈，普哀物命，永無誅伐之心。
translation: The king had a generous heart and sympathy for the lives of all living things, and he never had any intention of killing or injuring them.

source_sentence: 群臣不忍數為屬城小國所見陵易，忿不顧難，竊私舉兵，討伐諸國，即大殘殺人民。
translation: His ministers couldn't bear to be outmaneuvered by the views of the small states that were part of his city, so they became angry and ignored the difficulties, secretly and privately raised armies to invade the states, which meant greatly brutalizing the people.

source_sentence: 「『大王聞之，甚用悲痛，為之雨淚，皆為諸國死亡人民持服，猶喪其子，矜愍無極。
translation: "'When the great king heard about it, he was so saddened that he wept and wore tears as the people of those countries died, just as if they had lost their sons, and his pity was boundless.

source_sentence: 諸小國王見大國王，慈心矜念人民乃爾，即皆降伏來歸附之。
translation: When the smaller kings saw that the great king had compassion for their people, they all surrendered and came to be subordinate to them.

source_sentence: 其來歸附者，大王則為施設厨饍，大官設饍，皆須烹殺牛羊六畜，以具眾味。
translation: When they come to be subordinated, the great king prepares a meal for them, and the commander prepares a meal that includes cooking cattle, sheep, six animals, and many flavors.

source_sentence: 烹宰之時，輙當先白。
translation: When they're cooked, they'll always make a confession beforehand.

source_sentence: 王心雖慈，事不獲已，顉頭可之。
translation: Although the king is kind-hearted, he doesn't accept the task after it's done, so he approves of it with a bow.

source_sentence: 緣是得罪，勤苦如是。
translation: Because of this offense, he would work hard like this.

source_sentence: 每一念之，心甚懷寒，衣毛為竪，身體則為虛冷汗出。
translation: Whenever I think about it, my heart gets a chill, my clothes stand on end, and my body becomes cold and sweaty.

source_sentence: 我所以不語者，追憶過世所更吉凶、安危、成敗，恐復與會，故結舌不語至十三歲，冀以靜默，免瑕脫穢，出度塵勞，永辭於俗，不與厄會。
translation: That's why I don't speak, because I recall the fortune and misfortune, safety and security, and success and failure of past lives, and I'm afraid I'll be associated with them again, so I've kept my mouth shut and not spoken until I was 13 years old, hoping that with silence I'd be freed from blemish and defilement, escape from the dust and trouble, resign forever from the world, and not associate with the bad.

source_sentence: 適復念欲閉口不語，而當為王所見生埋，恐王後時，復得是殃，一入地獄無有出期。
translation: I was also mindful that if I wanted to keep my mouth shut and not speak, I would be buried in the king's presence, and I was afraid that the king would be condemned again later on and would go to hell with no hope of escape.

source_sentence: 我意不欲令王得罪，故復語耳。
translation: My intention is not to cause the king to be offended, so I'll say it again.

source_sentence: 徒欲為道，守意無為，不樂為王也。
translation: We only want to be on the road, so we'll guard our thoughts and do nothing, and we won't enjoy being the king.

source_sentence: 人居世間，恍惚若夢，室家歡娛，須臾間耳。
translation: When people live in the world, they're in a trance like a dream, and their homes are filled with joy in a moment's time.

source_sentence: 計命無幾，憂畏延長，樂少苦多，眾惱萬端。
translation: We count our lives to be few, our grief and fear to be prolonged, our pleasures to be few and painful, and our numerous afflictions to be numerous.

source_sentence: 是以智者，以國、財寶、恩愛為累，眾欲為塵。
translation: That's why wise people take countries, possessions, and favors as burdens, and numerous desires as dust.

source_sentence: 使我為王，當復憍泆貪求快意，令民憂煩，為天下之大患也。
translation: If I were king, I'd again become licentious and greedy for pleasure, causing the people to be sad and troubled, which would be a great danger to the world.

source_sentence: 故欲除憂，棄離塵累，反流索源，拯濟未度。
translation: So I want to remove their grief, discard the burden of the dust, and turn back the stream to search for its source to save what's yet to be saved.

source_sentence: 生世如寄，無一可怙，年衰歲移，老命促疾，不可逡蠕，去道日遠。
translation: His birth in the world is like a parasite, with no one to turn to, his years declining and shifting, his old age and rapid illness, and his inability to wander, and his departure from the path is becoming increasingly remote.

source_sentence: 不貪富貴，不重珍寶，棄捐世榮，思想大道，高翔遠逝，自濟於世。』
translation: Not craving wealth and riches, not valuing treasures, renouncing worldly prosperity, and thinking of the great way, they fly high and die far away, helping the world on their own.'

source_sentence: 「父王曰：『當那可爾，汝為智者，當原不及，不可便爾，故棄我去。』
translation: "The father said, 'Don't let him know that you're a wise man who's not worthy of the original, and you can't make it easy for him to abandon me.'

source_sentence: 王心悲喜，深悔所為。
translation: The king was saddened and delighted, and he deeply regretted what he had done.

source_sentence: 「太子復曰：『何聞父子，生而相棄？
translation: "The prince then asked, 'How could you hear of a father and son being born together and abandoning each other?'

source_sentence: 恩愛已乖，骨肉已離，為行己愆，不可聽觀。
translation: Having been betrayed by affection, my bones and flesh have been separated, and I've committed a transgression, I can't listen to and observe it.

source_sentence: 屈苦相迎，徒益勞煩。』
translation: To bend over backwards to welcome them would be a waste of effort.'

source_sentence: 父聞子語，見其志固，罔然失厝，慚愧忸怩，無辭可對。
translation: When the father heard his son's words, he was at a loss for words when he saw how resolute his intentions were, and he felt ashamed and coy, having no words to say in response.

source_sentence: 「王曰：『如汝前世作國王時，奉行諸善，纔有小失，非所憶知，而尚受罪，勤苦乃爾。
translation: "The king said, 'Just as in a previous life, when you were king, you upheld good qualities and committed only minor misdeeds that weren't recalled, yet you were still subject to punishment and hardship.

source_sentence: 今我治國不奉正法，既無微善，反是逐非，憍貴自恣，純行危殆，罪當何貲耶？』
translation: Now, I don't follow the right principles in ruling my country; I don't have subtle goodness, but I instead pursue what's wrong, become arrogant and lazy, and simply act dangerously; what will be the price of that sin?'

source_sentence: 便放太子聽行學道。
translation: He then released the prince to listen to his practice and train on the path.

source_sentence: 太子於是棄國捐王，不慕人物，一心專精，念道修德，功勳累積，遂至成佛。
translation: The prince then renounced his country and renounced the king, didn't admire people, concentrated his mind on the path and cultivated virtue, and accumulated merit that led him to become a buddha.

source_sentence: 佛已得道，復度十方諸天人民，不可稱計，無央數劫，不以為勞，菩薩所更勤苦如是。」
translation: After the Buddha attained the way, he also saved an incalculable number of gods and people in ten directions for an incalculably long eon without making it a labor of love, such as the bodhisattva's further exertion."

source_sentence: 佛言：「爾時，太子者，我身是也；父王者，今現我父閱頭檀是；母者，摩耶是；爾時相師婆羅門者，調達是；時僕者，阿若拘隣五人是也。
translation: The Buddha said, "At the time, the prince was me; the father was the king, who was now my father, who read the head; the mother was Māya; the commander of the Brahmins was Tathāgata; and the servants of the time were the five Ajñāta-Kauṇḍinya people.

source_sentence: 諸欲為道者，皆當承順佛教，無犯經戒；為道雖苦，勝在三惡道、八難處也。
translation: Everyone who wants to pursue the path should obey Buddhism and not violate the sūtras and precepts; although the path is painful, it's better than the three evil destinies and the eight difficult places.

source_sentence: 違戒犯禁，後墮惡道，得脫為人，當生貧苦，或作奴婢，願不自由；奉戒行善，三尊可得。」
translation: Those who violate the precepts and transgress the prohibitions will later fall into a bad path and be freed from being a human being who will be born into poverty or become a slave or servant, wishing not to be free; those who observe the precepts and do good deeds will attain the three honored ones."

source_sentence: 佛說如是，諸比丘眾、諸天人民，莫不歡喜，為佛作禮。
translation: When the Buddha said this, the crowd of monks and gods rejoiced and paid homage to him.

source_sentence: 佛說太子慕魄經
translation: Foshuo taizi mupo jing
